qas.question: A study showed that a task dogs do is bringing in what from the lawn?
Dogs often help clean in the kitchen by licking what?
In addition to dog dancing, what is another activity that families are doing that is centered around their pet?
What do many dogs have to do in the families where they live?
What are dogs often taught to bring in from outdoors?

context: Another study of dogs' roles in families showed many dogs have <a3_0>set tasks or routines<a3_0/> undertaken as family members, the most common of which was helping with the washing-up by licking the <a1_0>plates<a1_0/> in the dishwasher, and bringing in <a4_0>the <a0_0>newspaper<a4_0/><a0_0/> from the lawn. Increasingly, human family members are engaging in activities centered on the perceived needs and interests of the dog, or in which the dog is an integral partner, such as dog dancing and <a2_0>dog yoga.
